alfredsnippet.snippet:
"Specialization has never been the hallmark of greatness. Our belief that it is has almost eliminated people with a broad, all-embracing, relevant education. I have no doubt that we should aim at 'holism' (a word coined back in 1926 by General Smuts), where our sages for the future know about a host of facets of the world, and try constructively to understand the breadth of human endeavour."

- Brian J. Ford, The Cult of the Expert
